message.content:
cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper uses computer vision tools and a sensor to detect and recognize driver distraction, which falls under the category of computer vision (cs.CV) and human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The use of a driving simulator and the focus on real car systems suggest that robotics (cs.RO) is also a likely sub-category. The classification strategies used (AdaBoost and Hidden Markov Model) suggest machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) as possible sub-categories as well.
